channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harris’ Fake ‘Unity’ Schtick Might Work Better If She Weren’t Smearing Half The Country As Fascists
item.description: Kamala Harris is joyful, but also very, very angry.

item.title: Democracy Is Alive and Well in Brian Kemp’s Georgia
item.description: Record early-voting turnout in Georgia is a reminder that the state’s voting laws are voter-friendly, not ‘Jim Crow 2.0.’

item.title: Why Jeff Bezos blocked the Washington Post endorsement
item.description: It has to do with Blue Origin, one longtime advisor says.

item.title: Book Review: Resistance Money: A Philosophical Case for Bitcoin
item.description: Should I add bitcoin to my portfolio? If not, why not? This book will help advisors field these tough client questions.

item.title: What Will the Election Mean for Antitrust?
item.description: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump might recognize the danger of overregulation. Or they might give in to ideology and personal spats.

item.title: Unlocking Stock Market Success: Why You Should Embrace the Skew
item.description: By learning to appreciate positive skew and its associated tail events, investors can unlock the full potential of stock market gains.

item.title: Republicans Make Major Push For Early Voting After Arizona’s Largest County Telegraphs Election Day Problems
item.description: We need our people to 'vote early so the lines are not that long [and] nobody's discouraged' to vote, Gina Swoboda told The Federalist.

item.title: Wall Street’s Latest Flood: Private Credit
item.description: Private credit is a treacherous swamp full of opportunists. Is your consultant capable of defying the formidable odds of success?

item.title: Kamala Harris’ Unity Speech Was Riddled With Division, Delusion
item.description: As Harris again and again painted Trump as a tyrant, she insisted that it was 'time to stop pointing fingers ... and start locking arms.'

item.title: Biden calls Trump supporters 'garbage'
item.description: President Biden called supporters of former President Donald Trump human garbage on Tuesday.

item.title: Democrats make 'final pitch' to swing state voters in dead heat race
item.description: The Democratic National Committee launched a paid ad campaign in 25 swing state newspapers to make its "final pitch" to voters before the election.

item.title: Speech Tyranny in the U.K.?
item.description: Workplaces, colleges, and even pubs would likely face severe restrictions on speech rights under a new Labour bill.

item.title: About 475 damaged ballots retrieved from burned drop box in Washington state, auditor says
item.description: About 475 damaged ballots were retrieved from a ballot box that was burned early Monday in southwest Washington, a county official said Tuesday.

item.title: War-torn regions have keen interest in US elections
item.description: People around the world are paying attention to the US elections with an eye toward how a new president may impact conflicts abroad.

item.title: The Illegal-Immigrant Burden on Medicaid and Tax-Subsidized Care Is Growing
item.description: Fewer American taxpayers are supporting a growing population of Medicaid recipients and an unchecked influx of illegal immigrants.

item.title: Trump tells supporters to 'please forgive' Biden for 'garbage' comment

item.title: Early in-person voting kicks off in Oklahoma
item.description: Oklahoma began early in-person voting on Tuesday, joining much of the nation.
